intro: Seseli tauricum, commonly known as Tauric seseli, is a flowering plant native to the regions of the Caucasus and southern Russia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild aromatic scent, typical of the Apiaceae family. Seseli tauricum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
